verses.roman:
ṛṣīṇāṁ pitṛ-devānāṁ
suhṛdām api naḥ prabho
sarveṣām api bhūtānām
īpsitaḥ kratu-rāḍ ayam

synonyms: ṛṣīṇām—for the sages; pitṛ—departed forefathers; devānām—and demigods; suhṛdām—for the friends; api—also; naḥ—our; prabhoḥ—master; sarveṣām—for all; api—as well; bhūtānām—living beings; īpsitaḥ—desirable; kratu—of major Vedic sacrifices; rāṭ—king; ayam—this.
translation: Indeed, My lord, for the great sages, the forefathers and the demigods, for Our well-wishing friends and, indeed, for all living beings, the performance of this king of Vedic sacrifices is desirable.
